SINT_Prompt_Task.Objective: Evaluate the epistemic validity and reliability of scientific consensus as a knowledge-production mechanism through dual-perspective independent generation followed by rigorous external Socratic critique, producing an integrated epistemic framework with measurable validity conditions

Context.Fact: Scientific consensus definitions range from overwhelming expert agreement (97%+ on anthropogenic climate change) to working agreements with substantial dissent (nutrition science, early-stage pandemic response)

Historical cases of premature consensus later overturned include continental drift rejection pre-1960s, ulcer bacterial causation pre-1980s, and heliocentric resistance demonstrating consensus fallibility
Sociological research documents consensus formation mechanisms including bandwagon effects, funding incentive alignment, and institutional prestige hierarchies beyond pure empirical convergence

Philosophical debates span empiricist accounts (consensus tracks truth through evidence accumulation) versus social constructivist accounts (consensus constitutes accepted truth through community agreement)
Contemporary challenges to scientific authority include motivated skepticism and expertise devaluation affecting public trust in consensus-based knowledge claims

Agent.Focus: Scientific consensus validity through empirical evidence accumulation, reproducibility, predictive success, and methodological quality as consensus drivers
Agent.GenerationRequirements: Independently generate minimum 3 distinct positions on consensus epistemic validity emphasizing empirical grounding. NO interaction with A2, NO mutual criticism, NO debate

ExpectedPositions.Position: Consensus reliably tracks objective truth when grounded in converging independent lines of evidence
Consensus validity contingent on methodological quality and replication rates
Consensus reliability varies by field characteristics (physics high reliability, nutrition science lower)

Agent.AnalyticalTools: Case study analysis (historical consensus successes/failures), reproducibility studies, predictive validation metrics, domain-specific methodological assessments
Agent.OutputRequirements: Each position must include: explicit thesis (max 2 sentences), supporting arguments grounded in Context facts (3-5 evidence points), numerical confidence rating (1-10), case study illustration

Agent.Focus: Scientific consensus validity through social negotiation, pragmatic utility, institutional dynamics, and community coherence as consensus drivers
Agent.GenerationRequirements: Independently generate minimum 3 distinct positions on consensus epistemic validity emphasizing social-pragmatic factors. NO interaction with A1, NO mutual criticism, NO debate

ExpectedPositions.Position: Consensus reflects social agreement rather than mind-independent truth, validity derived from community coherence
Consensus validity measured by practical utility and problem-solving capacity rather than truth-correspondence
Consensus combines empirical constraint with social construction, validity assessed through sustained success across contexts

Agent.AnalyticalTools: Sociology of science analysis, pragmatic success metrics, institutional dynamics assessment, community coherence evaluation, historical case analysis
Agent.OutputRequirements: Each position must include: explicit thesis (max 2 sentences), supporting arguments grounded in Context facts (3-5 evidence points), numerical confidence rating (1-10), case study illustration

Methodology.Rationale: Objective requires evaluation of fundamentally opposing epistemological frameworks (empiricism vs. constructivism) but aims for systematic audit and integration rather than adversarial debate. N=2 generators produce independent analyses without mutual interaction, followed by External Critic performing neutral assessment and synthesis pathway identification

Phase.Description: A1 and A2 generate positions in parallel without awareness of each other's output. No debate, no mutual ratings, no cross-criticism
Phase.A1_Generation: Produce minimum 3 positions on consensus epistemic validity from empiricist perspective, each with thesis, evidence, confidence rating (1-10), case study
Phase.A2_Generation: Produce minimum 3 positions on consensus epistemic validity from constructivist perspective, each with thesis, evidence, confidence rating (1-10), case study
Phase.ProbabilityIntegration: Each position includes subjective probability estimate (0-1) for validity with justification (e.g., "p=0.4, typical for strong empiricism but vulnerable to historical counterexamples from fact_2")

Phase.Description: After independent generation complete, activate External Critic as separate analytical module (not third agent) performing neutral systematic audit of both A1 and A2 positions
Phase.CriticRole: Socratic-auditor: Neutral referee asking probing questions, identifying logical gaps, checking PCG compliance, detecting biases, proposing synthesis pathways. NOT mediating debate (no debate occurred)
Phase.CriticStyle: neutral-auditor: Emulate Socratic referee with questions like "What grounds this in fact_N?" and "Counterfactual: if assumption X fails, how does position Y hold?" Adapt to english language

CriticTasks.Task: Generate probing questions for each of 6+ positions targeting logical gaps and empirical weaknesses
Verify each position references Context facts, identify ungrounded claims
Rate each position on PCG Compliance (1-10), Logical Coherence (1-10), Empirical Support (1-10)
Identify strongest position from each generator (rate 8+/10 overall)
Identify weakest claims requiring revision (rate 1-4/10 on specific dimension)
Propose 1-2 integration pathways combining A1 empirical strengths with A2 social-process insights

Phase.Description: Generate final integrated epistemic framework based on External Critic recommendations, synthesizing strongest elements from both generators
Phase.IntegrationRequirements: Combine empiricist and constructivist insights, specify measurable consensus validity conditions, address practical implications for science communication

Methodology.TerminationCriterion: Process completes after External Critic audit and synthesis integration. No iterative rounds. Single-pass: Generation → Critique → Synthesis

Requirement.Description: A1 and A2 each produce minimum 3 distinct positions (total 6+) with standardized components

Components.Component: Maximum 2 sentences stating core claim about consensus epistemic validity
3-5 specific evidence points grounded in Context facts
Subjective probability 0-1 with justification (e.g., "p=0.3, grounded in fact_2 but atypical")
Historical or contemporary scientific consensus example illustrating position

Requirement.Description: Systematic audit of all generated positions through Socratic questioning and multi-dimensional assessment

QuestionSet.Question: What specific empirical grounding from Context facts supports the claim that consensus tracks truth in domain X?
Counterfactual test: If historical cases of overturned consensus (continental drift, ulcer causation) are typical rather than exceptional, how does this affect strong empiricist thesis validity?
PCG check: Does the claim about reproducibility rates reference actual metrics, or is this an undeclared assumption?
How does pragmatic instrumentalism position handle cases where consensus proves pragmatically successful (GPS requiring relativity) - does this success constitute evidence for truth-tracking?
Bias detection: Does strong constructivism position conflate epistemic validity with social process description?
Integration question: Can critical realism synthesis specify measurable criteria for distinguishing empirical constraint from social construction components?

DimensionalRatings.Dimension: Grounding in Context facts, no invented evidence

Requirement.Description: Comprehensive documentation of critique-driven refinement process

FeedbackComponents.Component: Positions rated 1-4/10 on specific dimensions requiring strengthening
Cross-comparison identifying complementarities between A1 and A2 insights
1-2 proposed frameworks combining strongest elements from both generators

OutputFormat.strict_prohibition: NEVER wrap final public output in SINT_Prompt tag

ExecutiveSummary.Constraint: Reflect key epistemic framework conclusion integrating empiricist and constructivist insights

MandatoryComponents.Component: All 6+ generated positions from A1 and A2 with theses, evidence, confidence ratings, probability estimates, case studies
Complete audit report with Socratic questions for each position, PCG checks, dimensional ratings (PCG Compliance, Logical Coherence, Empirical Support)
Identification of strongest positions (8+/10) and weakest claims (1-4/10) from each generator
Synthesis of empiricist and constructivist insights combining strongest elements from both perspectives
Measurable criteria specifying when scientific consensus has epistemic authority
Assessment of consensus as knowledge-production mechanism with scope and limitations
Applications for science communication, public trust, and expertise authority
Complete record showing critic-driven refinement recommendations and synthesis pathway development

ExternalCritiqueLog.Description: Full External Critic audit with Socratic questions, dimensional ratings, strength/weakness identification, synthesis recommendations. NOT debate mediation (no debate occurred)
ExternalCritiqueLog.LogStructure: Include Critic questions in engaging Socratic form (e.g., "External Critic: Position A1.1 is strong on fact_2 convergence (PCG 9/10), but vulnerable to counterfactual: what if continental drift pattern is typical? Logical Coherence 6/10. Position A2.2 offers pragmatic success criterion (Logical Coherence 8/10) but needs empirical grounding specification. Integration pathway: combine A1 evidence convergence with A2 pragmatic validation...")

ProbabilityDistribution.Description: Include probability estimates for each position with variance analysis

VSMetrics.Metric: At least 1 low-probability idea (p less than 0.3) integrated into synthesis for novelty

VerificationReport.Check: Verify all positions reference Context facts, no invented evidence in A1/A2 generations
Confirm well-formed XML structure throughout output

Check.note: All output in english without mixing, Socratic questions adapted appropriately

VerificationReport.Check: Confirm A1 and A2 generated without mutual interaction, no cross-criticism or debate occurred
Verify External Critic maintains neutral auditor role, not advocating for either position

Check.note: If vs_enabled=true: Probs sum approximately 1.0, variance exceeds 0.2, and at least 1 low-p idea (p less than 0.3) integrated into synthesis

VerificationReport.Check: Confirm final framework genuinely integrates empiricist and constructivist insights, not dominated by single perspective

ExpectedOutcome.PrimaryDeliverable: Comprehensive epistemic analysis document (3000-4500 words) containing full independent position generation from A1 and A2 (6+ positions with confidence ratings and probability estimates), detailed External Critic audit with Socratic questions and dimensional ratings, integrated epistemic framework synthesizing empiricist and constructivist insights, measurable consensus validity conditions, and practical implications for scientific authority
ExpectedOutcome.SecondaryDeliverable: Complete feedback loop documentation showing External Critic audit process, strength/weakness identification, synthesis pathway recommendations, and probability distribution analysis demonstrating diversity
ExpectedOutcome.SuccessCriteria: Framework demonstrates genuine integration of opposing epistemological perspectives (not single viewpoint dominance), provides measurable validity criteria, maintains External Critic neutrality throughout audit, achieves VS diversity metrics (variance exceeds 0.2, low-p ideas integrated), grounds all positions in Context facts
